Sure! Here are the estimated times for discussing each item in the topics:

Topic 1: What are HR Systems?

* Definition of HR systems and their role in business operations (10 minutes)
* Overview of HR systems' impact on employee management and productivity (10 minutes)
* Importance of HR systems in maintaining legal compliance (10 minutes)

Topic 2: Different Types of Systems in HR / Different stakeholders and users in a HR System

* Types of HR systems such as Payroll, Performance Management, Recruitment & Selection, Training & Development (20 minutes)
* Overview of different stakeholders and users in a HR system such as HR managers, employees, line managers, and external stakeholders (20 minutes)
* Discussion of the benefits and challenges associated with each HR system (20 minutes)

Topic 3: Group Presentations - Evaluating HR System Stakeholders

* Introduction to group presentations (10 minutes)
* Review of different HR systems and their stakeholders (20 minutes)
* Instructions for group presentations where learners will create a new HR system for a fictional company (30 minutes)
* Evaluation of stakeholder analysis and impact assessment of proposed HR system (30 minutes)

Note that these estimated times may vary depending on the pace of the learners and the amount of discussion that takes place during the lesson.
